title: fatal error for (wrong-import-position) and can't write the issue template for the crash

labels.name: Duplicate üê´
labels.description: Duplicate of an already existing issue

labels.name: Crash üí•
labels.description: A bug that makes pylint crash

body:
### Bug description

So today I run the style-test of CICD for my on our GitLab site, and it got fatal errors. But locally the test was passed. 

Then I re-ran the style-test task that got passed result two days ago, and it got a failed result!

Therefore,  I figure that I should open an issue for it, as the message suggested.

the code is as follows. (I only add code environment for lines started with '#', due to markdown mechanism.)
--------------------------------------------------------------
```python
"""
Django settings for backend project.

Generated by 'django-admin startproject' using Django 3.2.7.

For more information on this file, see
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.2/topics/settings/

For the full list of settings and their values, see
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.2/ref/settings/
"""

from pathlib import Path
from os import path

# Build paths inside the project like this: BASE_DIR / 'subdir'.`
BASE_DIR = Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent


# Quick-start development settings - unsuitable for production`
# See https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.2/howto/deployment/checklist/`

# SECURITY WARNING: keep the secret key used in production secret!`
SECRET_KEY = 'django-insecure-77h-thag_e5k2+s7j!$=iz%a4_6%!_h-7tx8(wp$p2)pxzcu1a'

# SECURITY WARNING: don't run with debug turned on in production!`
DEBUG = True`

ALLOWED_HOSTS = ['*']`
```

### Configuration

_No response_

### Command used

```shell
pylint backend
```


### Pylint output

```shell
************* Module backend.settings
backend/settings.py:13:0: C0413: Import "from pathlib import Path" should be placed at the top of the module (wrong-import-position)
backend/settings.py:14:0: C0413: Import "from os import path" should be placed at the top of the module (wrong-import-position)
Can't write the issue template for the crash in /opt/app/.cache/pylint/pylint-crash-2022-03-25-08.txt.
backend/settings.py:1:0: F0001: Fatal error while checking 'backend/settings.py'. Please open an issue in our bug tracker so we address this. There is a pre-filled template that you can use in '/opt/app/.cache/pylint/pylint-crash-2022-03-25-08.txt'. (fatal)
```


### Expected behavior

expected to be normal, with no error.

### Pylint version

```shell
pylint 2.13.0
astroid 2.11.1
Python 3.8.5 (default, Sep 10 2020, 16:47:10)
[GCC 8.3.0]
```


### OS / Environment

Linux version 4.15.0-142-generic (buildd@lgw01-amd64-036) (gcc version 7.5.0 (Ubuntu 7.5.0-3ubuntu1~18.04)) #146-Ubuntu SMP Tue Apr 1301:11:19 UTC 2021
